item.description: eu velit magna aliqua hendrerit One of the assumptions in financial modelling is that the returns of a security is a random variable. The standard deviation of the return is considered to be a measure of risk. The expected return should be higher for riskier securites and lower for safer securities. For a portfolio with $N$ securities, Portfolio value at time=0, $V(0)=\sum_{i=1}^N x_i S_i(0)$, where $x_i$ is the number of shares and $S_i(0)$ is the price of the security $i$.
